Reviews.Title: “rude manager & none of the facilities were available!”
Reviews.Author: raro2121
Reviews.Content: I have never written a review before but after I stayed at the Rio Hotel Dubai I felt I had to make other people aware of what happened to me on my trip. To begin with, my trip to dubai was only for 4days, for entire trip I was there the pool, gym, sauna & steam room were not available. I was not told this when I checked in or before I booked my trip. I rang reception three days consecutively to find out if the pool was open yet as each day they would say 'tomorrow'. On the 3rd day I complained the manager who told me the pool & sauna etc would not open for another week! I told him he should have informed all the residents during check in time or thrown a letter under the doors of each resident so they were aware of this. At the end of the day i'm not staying there for free & i'm paying to use facilties they are not providing me. The manager found this all amusing and said "why should I tell people the pool isn't working" (of course- he wants to make money- forget what people think). When I told him I will be writing a review about his attitude/hotel etc he said "go on then, I don't care". I found that extremely rude and unprofessional. Moreover, the bathroom was very smelly and there was not enough hot water to have a shower lasting more than 6mins! There was black marks all over the carpet. They were supposed to get a maintenance guy to come and check it out, did that happen.. no! I paid a lot of money for this trip and only got half the things (bed & food) no pool, sauna, gym nothing. I asked the manager to allow me and my family to check out late as a form of 'compensation' and he refused. I didn't get any money back or nothing. I would not recommend going to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Decent room, but not much in the way of amenities”
Reviews.Author: ArchiTraveller
Reviews.Content: The hotel stands alone, away from most of the attractions of Dubai. This means that you pretty much have to take a taxi anywhere you might want to go (though, because there isn't much around it, sometimes it's a wait to get a taxi). It isn't near the metro, and there aren't dining options nearby. They do offer a restaurant in the hotel, which isn't bad. The room I had was quite comfortable, and the staff was really warm and accommodating. The guest rooms face either the skyline of downtown Dubai, or the industrial port. I had a room on the skyline side, and never tired of seeing the Burj Kalifa glimmering in the morning and evening light. I don't think that the view from the other side was nearly as good. It appears that there had been a significant leak in the rooftop pool at one point in time. I was on the 4th floor (the highest floor of guest rooms), and there were a couple spots of water damage in my room (nothing major). Walking down the 4th floor corridor, however, paneling on the wall was buckled and I saw in to a few other rooms while they were being cleaned that appeared to have some pretty significant water damage.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money. No inconvenience!!”
Reviews.Author: Avtar K
Reviews.Content: Best Thing about this hotel is its location. Situated in the heart of dubai (bur dubai) this hotel is merely a few kms away from all the tourist spots.. Be it the dubai creek or the dubai mall.. Also nice indian eating joints nearby.. All in all you would get a comfortable 3 star stay.. Mot much luxurious though.. But no inconvenience in any way possible.. Just dont forget to buy 6-12 drinking water bottle pack before even checking into the hotel.. And if ure in dubai do buy sony products from the local market.. Theres a great price difference..

Reviews.Title: “Good and Pleasant Place”
Reviews.Author: rajeshkumar1969
Reviews.Content: We spent 5 days in the Hotel which has all facilities with 3 Star catagory. Breakfast used to be marvellous with all varities of Indian food. Roof top swimming pool and health club. Travel desk is very friendly and staff is mainly Indian with lot of attention.

Reviews.Title: “cheap and old”
Reviews.Author: arabraja
Reviews.Content: i stayed 3 days back in rio hotel dubai,the room and bathroom are very small i have ever seen with very old furniture,when you enter in room you will say"i could pay little more and take a better hotel"

Reviews.Title: “VALUE FOR MONEY”
Reviews.Author: punmad
Reviews.Content: It is a very good place to stay and has some good restaurants and has two good night clubs including one which is Indian. They also have a kewa lounge bar which is the latest to their attraction which is a very good place to hang out which serves lunch and dinner and also has dj after 11pm at night until 3pm. A nice place to hangout and they have a very good indian restaurant serving some delicious food called glassy junction. Do not miss to stay in this hotel while planning a trip to dubai.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel value for money”
Reviews.Author: pradipcs
Reviews.Content: Good hotel, neat and clean and value for money The room I had was spacious and pretty, the breakfast is good and the distance to the beach and market is limited.

Reviews.Title: “Good Ambience,worth a stay”
Reviews.Author: DoctorPune
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situated in a less crowded part of Bur Dubai near the New Gold Sukh.The rooms are quite good in size and well appointed. The restaurant is good and spacious with good selection of Indian and continental quisine. Availability of public transport is good. Shopping areas are pretty close and the metro is at a walking distance. If you want a quite and budget stay Hotel Rio is a good choice

Reviews.Title: “Superb!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Rica04
Reviews.Content: We had an amazing time in Dubai, best of all we had an fantastic stay at the Rio Hotel. All of the Staff are so friendly from the Transfer Shuttle driver, Receptionist, Restaurant personel and the Housekeeping ladies...they made us feel at home!!! The Spa is a Bonus as thei oprating hours till 2 in the morning - excellent service!! Dubai is a must for every traveller, Rio Hotel is also ideal located, taxi service can take you if it is to far to walk.
